intro: Frostia berteroi, commonly known as the African snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and rocky garden environments. Frostia berteroi is known for its frost resistance, which contributes to its name. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year in mild climates.
